Assigning Version Labels

Assign a version label to a specific revision when you want to distinguish the revision from other revisions within the same versioned file or group of versioned files. You can assign version labels to a specific revision, a versioned file, or to versioned files within projects or folders.

To assign a version label:

  1. Select the files, projects, or folders you want to assign a version label.

  2. Select Actions | Version Label | Assign. The Assign Version Label to File dialog box appears.

  3. Enter a version label in the Assign version label field.

    By default, the version label is assigned to the default revision of the file you selected.

  4. To assign the label to a revision other than the default revision, enter the revision number in the To revision field.

  5. To keep the version label on the tip revision, select the Float label with tip check box.

  6. To prevent from overwriting a version label, select one of the following in the If version label exists list: Prompt to prompt for confirmation before overwriting the version label, Reassign to reassign the version label without prompting, or Don't reassign to prevent the version label from being overwritten.

  7. To assign the version label to files in subprojects of the selected project or project database, select the Include files in subprojects check box.

  8. Click OK.
